control
Class Logger

java.lang.Object
  control.Logger

public class Logger
extends java.lang.Object

The Logger keeps all the logs required for the simulator to run, the logs are:

  • EventLog
  • The available trucks
  • The available Drivers
  • The positions of the running trucks
  • The queue status

Version:
April 2010
Author:
Jorge Alexis Hernandez

Constructor Summary
Logger()
          Creates an eventLog and initializes the available trucks and drivers

Method Detail

getLogCopy

public EventLog getLogCopy()
Returns:
a copy of the EventLog as it is at the moment of calling the method

getAvailableTrucksCopy

public EventLog getAvailableTrucksCopy(java.util.List notRunning)
gets the Trucks from the provided list and creates an Event Log with them, set the event log and then returns the EventLog

Parameters:
notRunning - a list of the Trucks not running
Returns:
a copy of the available trucks EventLog

getAvailableDriversCopy

public EventLog getAvailableDriversCopy(java.util.List drivers)
gets the Drivers from the provided list and creates an Event Log with them, set the event log and then returns the EventLog

Parameters:
drivers - a list of the drivers not running
Returns:
a copy of the available Drivers EventLog

getQueueStatusCopy

public EventLog getQueueStatusCopy(QueueSim queue)
gets status queue in list form and creates an event log, sets it up as the current QueueStatus EventLog and returns it

Parameters:
queue - a list with the status of the Queue
Returns:
a copy of the QueueStatus log

getPositionsCopy

public EventLog getPositionsCopy()
Returns:
a copy of the positions EventLog not a a mere reference
